intro: Wrightia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar ash or white ash, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along streambanks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
